metadata.name: Creation of WerFault.exe/Wer.dll in Unusual Folder
metadata.comment: Detects the creation of a file named "WerFault.exe" or "wer.dll" in an uncommon folder, which could be a sign of WerFault DLL hijacking.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\werfault.exe')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\wer.dll'))) AND NOT (startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\softwaredistribution\\')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\syswow64\\')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\winsxs\\'))))

output.summary: Detects the creation of a file named "WerFault.exe" or "wer.dll" in an uncommon folder, which could be a sign of WerFault DLL hijacking.
